t: How*pn joyful is the one whose*ln transgression is forgiven, whose*ln sin is covered!
How*ln joyful is a person whom the*ln Lord*s does not charge with iniquity and*ln in whose spirit is no deceit!
When*pn I kept silent, my bones became brittle from*ln my groaning all day long.
For*ln day and night your hand was heavy on me; my*ln strength was drained as*ln in the summer’s heat. Selah*ig
Then*ln I acknowledged my sin to you and*ln did not conceal my iniquity. I*ln said, “I will confess my transgressions to the Lord,”*s and*ln you forgave the guilt of my sin. Selah*ig
Therefore*pn let everyone who is faithful pray to you immediately. When*ln great floodwaters come, they*ln will not reach him.
You*ln are my hiding place; you*ln protect me from trouble. You*ln surround me with joyful shouts of deliverance. Selah*ig
I*pn will instruct you and show you the way to go; with*ln my eye on you, I will give counsel.
Do*ln not be like a horse or mule, without*ln understanding, that*ln must be controlled with bit and bridle or*ln else it will not come near you.
Many*pn pains come to the wicked, but*ln the one who trusts in the Lord*s will*ln have faithful love surrounding him.
Be*ln glad in the Lord*s and rejoice, you*ln righteous ones; shout*ln for joy, all*ln you upright in heart.
